item.title: New things Half-Life 3 related?
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
Yeah, basically.

ARG #1: Started in Portal, affected only Portal, did not break Portal, only added, people’s conclusion? Half-Life 3! Result? Portal-related. [COLOR=‘Black’]Who’da thunk?

The update backlash was ridiculous. Game is broken to have Korean language, Steam PR says they’re fixing it with some “secret” message in, guess what? Korean! They’re not joking, they clearly were trying to get us to decode it.

How many serious ARG’s has Valve set up in their 16 years? 2? I think their was one just before Portal 2 came out, though I don’t remember much of it.

Now I’m just ranting, so I should probably stop…

I do find it hilarious what people can try and piece together, though. From huge strings of numbers to vague relations.

Read full topic

item.title: New things Half-Life 3 related?
item.dc:creator: lunertexcosmo
item.description:
Crypt19:

So basically Valve accidentally broke something for a short amount of time (as they usually do) and it takes people for a ride? Wasn’t the 2013 SDK and Source code released a few days ago? Maybe they just mucked something up in preparation somehow. Not everything that happens with Valve/Steam is worth trying to find an ARG in. It only gets you angry.

Yup. It was an unintended side effect from Portal 2’s ARG. Now anytime a Valve game is updated, data miners dig through the code in order to find anything Half-Life 3 related. So when a major change happens to HL2, intentional or not, we get what happened with this. I even saw people on the Steam forums convincing everyone that there was a picture of Kim Jong-Un where Dr. Breen was supposed to be. Pretty insane.

Read full topic

item.title: New things Half-Life 3 related?
item.dc:creator: KyuuGryphon
item.description:
More as in they’re not invested in any rumours or ARG or anything that pops up, I guess. I dunno.

As for me, I’m just tired of waiting. I’ll jump all over it when it comes out, of course, but for now I just don’t really care. Something like that.

Read full topic

item.title: New things Half-Life 3 related?
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
Is… is that even possible? To “give up” on waiting? It’s not like they’re just going to “disown” Half-Life just because it takes so long. They’ll be right back as soon as something official is crops up.

Read full topic

item.title: New things Half-Life 3 related?
item.dc:creator: KyuuGryphon
item.description:
I think it just goes to show how desperate people are at this point. The Surgeon Simulator thing actually seemed plausible (I mean Valve did do that whole GLaDOS@Home thing for P2), the Korean… yeah, not so much.

Regardless of if something pops up soon or not, I know a few people who have declared that they’ve given up on waiting. Can’t say I’m much further behind, myself.

Read full topic

item.title: New things Half-Life 3 related?
item.dc:creator: lunertexcosmo
item.description:
Apparently Half-Life 2 had something screwy going on a few days ago. I didn’t hear about this but after some google searching, it popped up on a lot of game sites.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cXI1t_IgRqs

Basically, there was an update that had everyone speaking Korean and apparently some slightly updated models.

I have no idea what any of this means, if anything, but I thought you guys would get a kick out of this.

Here’s a news blurb about it: https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_detailpage&v=K6DCyGw_gRk#t=41s

Apparently, it was dismissed by a Valve employee as a mistake but it’s still pretty interesting…

EDIT: It looks like the updates models were just from one video which was spread around other sites. I still want to believe that it’s true, especially with the Surgeon Simulator stuff. That video also adds something to the Saturn stuff that involves something with a Lambda too, so it’s still worth looking into. But as it always does, it’s probably going to be nothing. Sigh…

Read full topic
